property.name: Izod Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 180 defines the method used for pendulums to determine the impact resistance of a plastic specimen when supported in a cantilever configuration. Test results are used to evaluate the resilience of materials, typically plastics.

property.name: Rockwell Hardness Test (Scale A)
property.description: The Rockwell hardness test is an empirical indentation hardness test that can provide useful information about metallic materials.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing

https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/e.title: UPC Number
https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/e.description: UPC (aka UPC-A) consists of 12 numeric digits that are uniquely assigned to each trade item. Along with the related EAN barcode, the UPC is the barcode mainly used for scanning of trade items at the point of sale, per GS1 specifications.

https://www.pma.com/content/articles/201.title: PLU Number
https://www.pma.com/content/articles/201.description: PLUs are a system of numbers that uniquely identify bulk produce sold in grocery stores and supermarkets.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) can be used by a company to uniquely identify all of its trade items.

https://w3id.org/traceability#ChemicalPr.title: Chemical Property
https://w3id.org/traceability#ChemicalPr.description: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.title: Formula
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/for.description: A chemical formula is a way of presenting information about the chemical proportions of atoms that constitute a particular chemical compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, commas and plus and minus signs.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChI
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a textual identifier for chemical substances, designed to provide a standard way to encode molecular information and to facilitate the search for such information in databases and on the web.

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.title: InChIKey
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/chebi/inc.description: The condensed, 27 character InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm), designed to allow for easy web searches of chemical compounds.

schema.title: Chemical Property
schema.description: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

formula.title: Formula

inchi.title: InChI
inchi.description: The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) is a textual identifier for chemical substances, designed to provide a standard way to encode molecular information and to facilitate the search for such information in databases and on the web.

inchikey.title: InChIKey
inchikey.description: The condensed, 27 character InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm), designed to allow for easy web searches of chemical compounds.

property.name: Rockwell Hardness Test (Scale A)
property.description: The Rockwell hardness test is an empirical indentation hardness test that can provide useful information about metallic materials.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Charpy Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.description: ISO 148-1:2016 specifies the Charpy (V-notch and U-notch) pendulum impact test method for determining the energy absorbed in an impact test of metallic materials. This part of ISO 148 does not cover instrumented impact testing, which is specified in ISO 14556.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

property.name: Izod Impact Strength Test
property.description: ISO 180 defines the method used for pendulums to determine the impact resistance of a plastic specimen when supported in a cantilever configuration. Test results are used to evaluate the resilience of materials, typically plastics.

property.name: Torque-controlled fatigue testing
property.description: ISO 1352:2011 specifies the conditions for performing torsional, constant-amplitude, nominally elastic stress fatigue tests on metallic specimens without deliberately introducing stress concentrations. The tests are carried out at ambient temperature (ideally at between 10 °C and 35 °C) in air by applying a pure couple to the specimen about its longitudinal axis.

https://w3id.org/traceability#IntentToSe.title: IntentToSell
https://w3id.org/traceability#IntentToSe.description: A simple case where an entity (person or organization) wishes to notify some third party that they intend to sell some product, likely into a different geographic region than in originated in.  This is a highly simplified version of an LOI that can be used to identify and declare intent earlier in the process than would be possible otherwise.  This object may be easily subclassed for extension with other data for other cases where additional regulatory data may be required

https://w3id.org/traceability#dfn-entiti.title: Seller
https://w3id.org/traceability#dfn-entiti.description: Entity that is declaring their intention for a product to be used at a different location than where it was created.

https://w3id.org/traceability#dfn-entiti.title: Purchaser
https://w3id.org/traceability#dfn-entiti.description: Entity that is expected to receive some amount of the product, though possibly a reseller.

https://www.gs1.org/voc/Product.title: Product
https://www.gs1.org/voc/Product.description: Product details as specified in the Product.json schema

https://schema.org/DateTime?v=2.title: Sell By Date
https://schema.org/DateTime?v=2.description: Date delcared as a non-binding target to sell product by.

https://schema.org/Place.title: Place
https://schema.org/Place.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://schema.org/GeoCoordinates.title: Geographic Coordinates
https://schema.org/GeoCoordinates.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

schema.title: Place
schema.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical location.

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

geo.title: Geographic Coordinates
geo.description: Links to information about geocoordinates for a place.

address.title: Postal Address
address.description: The postal address for an organization or place.

https://schema.org/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://schema.org/PostalAddress.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.title: Organization Name
https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

https://schema.org/streetAddress.title: Street Address
https://schema.org/streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

https://schema.org/addressLocality.title: Address Locality
https://schema.org/addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city.

https://schema.org/addressRegion.title: Address Region
https://schema.org/addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format for example NJ.

https://schema.org/addressCountry.title: Address Country
https://schema.org/addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.title: Cross Street
https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.title: County Code
https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

https://schema.org/postalCode.title: Postal Code
https://schema.org/postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.

schema.title: Product
schema.description: A product

sizeOrAmount.title: Size or Amount
sizeOrAmount.description: The size or amount of the product

sku.title: Sku Number
sku.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

https://w3id.org/traceability#ProductReg.title: Product Registration Evidence Document
https://w3id.org/traceability#ProductReg.description: Evidence data for a registered eCommerce Product

https://schema.org/category.title: A category for the product item.

https://schema.org/inProductGroupWithID.title: Indicates the productGroupID for a ProductGroup

https://schema.org/releaseDate.title: Release date of a product or product model

https://schema.org/manufacturer.title: Manufacturer name or brand of the product

https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number of the manufacturer issued by GS1 (required), for more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://schema.org/leiCode.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/leiCode.description: A Legal Entity Identifier of the manufacturer issued bei GLEIF (required), for more information see https://gleif.org

https://schema.org/material.title: Material the product is made from

schema.title: Product Registration Evidence Document
schema.description: Evidence data for a registered eCommerce Product

category.title: A category for the product item.
examples: Example Product Category (required)

inProductGroupWithID.title: Indicates the productGroupID for a ProductGroup
examples: valid Product Group ID number per schema.org, could be NULL (required)

productID.title: Product ID
examples: Product number of registering Legal Entity such as an ISBN (required)

mpn.title: Manufacturer Part Number (MPN)
examples: Manufacturer part number (required)

gtin.title: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)
examples: valid GTIN as number or URL per GS1 spec(required)

isAccessoryOrSparePartFor.title: Is accessory or sparepart for
examples: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part; may be empty (required)

releaseDate.title: Release date of a product or product model
examples: date when product (version) was 1st released (required)

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer name or brand of the product
examples: name of the manufacturer (required)

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number of the manufacturer issued by GS1 (required), for more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

leiCode.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
leiCode.description: A Legal Entity Identifier of the manufacturer issued bei GLEIF (required), for more information see https://gleif.org

name.title: Name of the product item
examples: short name of product (required)

description.title: Description of the product item
examples: Description of product (required)

model.title: Model of the product
examples: produdct model name, a URL is also allowed (required)

color.title: Color of the product
examples: color of product -- 'mix' is allowed (required)

material.title: Material the product is made from
examples: Material the product is made from, could specified as 'composits' (required)

weight.title: Weight of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measrure (kg) (required)

height.title: Height of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measrure (meter) (required)

width.title: Width of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measrure (meter) (required)

depth.title: Depth of the Product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measrure (meter)(required)

url.title: Url or the product item
examples: URL of the product; could be empty (required)

isBasedOn.title: Is based on
examples: URI for the resource from which this work is derived e.g. patent or from which it is a modification or adaption; could be empty (required)

image.title: Image of the product
examples: encoded picture of the product as a URI/URL (required)

https://schema.org/QuantitativeValue.title: Quantitative Value
https://schema.org/QuantitativeValue.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes

schema.title: Quantitative Value
schema.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes

https://w3id.org/traceability#ppq203.title: PPQ 203 Agricultural Foreign Site Inspection
https://w3id.org/traceability#ppq203.description: United States Department of Agriculture Foreign Site Certificate of Inspection and/or Treatment.

https://w3id.org/traceability#foreignPor.title: Foreign Port of Export
https://w3id.org/traceability#foreignPor.description: Foreign port which the shipment passed through as an export to the US

https://w3id.org/traceability#portOfEntr.title: Port of Entry
https://w3id.org/traceability#portOfEntr.description: US port through which the imports passed.

https://w3id.org/traceability#signatureD.title: signatureDate
https://w3id.org/traceability#signatureD.description: Date when the inspection was signed by the inspection officer.

foreignPortExport.title: Foreign Port of Export
